body: Would it be possible to implement the https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/api/org/junit/jupiter/api/extension/ExtensionContext.Store.CloseableResource.html interface, pass your resource (or a wrapper object that holds it) to the context store and let store care about calling your close method?

@sormuras i had a look into it and the following issues are blocking us from using this approach:
- failures in the cleanup / release of a resource are not related to the original test. The original test is in status "passed", but the cleanup failed.
- all resources are releases at the end of the class, also for Lifecycle.PER_METHOD. Our resources are bound to a limited set of physical devices, shared between different people. This would end in tests not completed because the lack of free resources.

Is it possible to change the lifecycle of the Store to get it more bound to the TestInstance?

Thanks in advance and best regards
J√∂rg

Would a pull request with this TestInstanceFinalizer feature in principle be accept? 
I didn't try to implement it so far, but i would like to give it a chance.

Best regards
J√∂rg

> Would a pull request with this TestInstanceFinalizer feature in principle be accept?

Since the team has not yet decided to support such an extension API, a PR would not be appropriate at the moment.

However, I'm going to slate this for _team discussion_ for 5.6 since we have received similar requests for a `Store` bound to the current test instance for other use cases.

Naming proposals from our team call:

- `TestInstanceFinalizer`
- `TestInstanceCleaner`
- `TestInstanceDestructor`
- `TestInstanceCloser`
- `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback`
- `TestInstanceEraser`
- `TestInstanceCleanupCallback`
- `JustBeforeAfterTestInstanceCallback`

Now we just need to decide on one of those or sth. better...

@joerg1985 Alternative proposals welcome!

> or is it possible to rename the existing class?

No, it is not possible to rename `TestInstancePostProcessor`.

rename.from: TestInstanceFinalizer as counterpart to the TestInstancePostProcessor
rename.to: Introduce TestInstancePreDestroyCallback as counterpart to TestInstancePostProcessor

body: I'd like to work on this please

Summary of approach:

New:
- `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback` - pass in testInstance object
- `TestInstancePreDestroyCallbackTests` - be sure to assert if cleanup fails test should fail
Update:
- `ClassBasedTestDescriptor.after()` - invoke `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback's` - derive testInstance from `ExtensionContext`
- `TestMethodTestDescriptor.execute()` - invoke `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback's` after call to `invokeAfterEachCallbacks`, looks like can leverage `invokeAllAfterMethodsOrCallbacks` with  `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback.class`
- `TestInstancePostProcessorTests`

Implementation in progress, initial testing looks correct although more test cases required and documentation needs finishing - a few days effort remaining.

> `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback` - pass in testInstance object

Yes, and the `ExtensionContext`.

> `TestMethodTestDescriptor.execute()` - invoke `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback's` after call to `invokeAfterEachCallbacks`, looks like can leverage `invokeAllAfterMethodsOrCallbacks` with  `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback.class`

Generally, it depends on the `TestInstance.Lifecycle` when `TestInstancePreDestroyCallback` needs to be called. You might be able to check whether the `TestInstances` in the `ExtensionContext` differ from the parent and, if so, only call it then.
